intro: Aglaia poilanei, commonly known as the Papuan aglaia, is a species of flowering plant native to the rainforests of Indonesia and Papua New Guinea. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other tropical hardwoods. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, fragrant flowers that are typically yellow or greenish-yellow in color. Its fruits are woody capsules that contain several seeds, and it plays a role in the local ecosystem by providing habitat and food for various wildlife. Due to its limited distribution and habitat-specific requirements, Aglaia poilanei is considered a rare and endangered species.
